result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Stephen M Thomas was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Stephen M Thomas was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Case 11CF514.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Restitution of $1,328.40 (payable to Bitco Insurance Company) is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court costs, DNA surcharge, Blood draw fee and Transcript fee are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Brookfield Police Department.  Transcript Fee to be forwarded to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock device installed for the period of Extended Supervision/Probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Stephen M Thomas in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1 and count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1 and count 3.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 4 is dismissed by operation of law.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 6 Years.
Initial Confinement:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
Consecutive to:  Waukesha County Case 11CF514
  

36 Months D/L REVOCATION.
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Restitution:  $1,328.40 (to be paid to Bitco insurance company - to be paid before costs/fines/surcharges).
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $40 (to be forward to Town of Brookfield Police Department);
TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $8 (to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office).

FINE:  $2,327
DNA Sample (court waives sample ONLY) and surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of the Extended Supervision.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.




Count 3:
Total Prison: 3 Years.
Initial Confinement: 1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  1.5 Years.
Consecutive to:  Waukesha County Case 11CF514 & Count 1.
STAYED. 

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Consecutive to:  Waukesha County Case 11CF514 & Count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waived.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
